intro: Pentapanax leschenaultii var. villosus, commonly known as the hairy pentapanax, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with numerous small, serrated leaflets. The plant features distinctive, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, often accompanied by hairy foliage. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its ornamental value and unique morphology make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
